abstractText: Phytochemical investigation of the whole plants of Vernonia gratiosa Hance. led in the isolation and identification of two new stigmastane-type steroidal glucosides (1–2), namely vernogratiosides A (1), and B (2). Their chemical structures were fully elucidated based on 1D/2D NMR spectroscopic, HRESI-MS data analyses, and by producing derivatives by chemical reactions. The binding potential of the isolated compounds to replicase protein − main protease of SARS-CoV-2 were examined using the molecular docking simulations. Our results show that the isolated steroidal glucosides (1–2) bind to the substrate‐binding site of SARS-CoV-2 main protease with binding affinities of –7.2 and –7.6 kcal/mol, respectively, as well as binding abilities equivalent to N3 inhibitor that has already been reported (–7.5 kcal/mol).

references.title: Cytotoxic triterpene saponins from the mangrove Aegiceras corniculatum

sections.text: Phytochemical investigation of the whole plants of Vernonia gratiosa Hance. led in the isolation and identification of two new stigmastane-type steroidal glucosides (1–2), namely vernogratiosides A (1), and B (2). Their chemical structures were fully elucidated based on 1D/2D NMR spectroscopic, HRESI-MS data analyses, and by producing derivatives by chemical reactions. The binding potential of the isolated compounds to replicase protein − main protease of SARS-CoV-2 were examined using the molecular docking simulations. Our results show that the isolated steroidal glucosides (1–2) bind to the substrate‐binding site of SARS-CoV-2 main protease with binding affinities of –7.2 and –7.6 kcal/mol, respectively, as well as binding abilities equivalent to N3 inhibitor that has already been reported (–7.5 kcal/mol). Keywords: Vernonia gratiosa; stigmastane-type steroidal glucoside; SARS-CoV-2 main protease; molecular docking.

sections.heading: Acid hydrolyses of compound 1 and 2
sections.text:
The compounds 1 and 2, (2 mg), was refluxed in 10% HCl in 75% EtOH (3 mL) for 6 h. After cooling, the reaction mixture was concentrated in a water bath at 40 °C and extracted with EtOAc (3 mL). The aqueous layer containing the sugar was re-dissolved in 1 mL of pyridine and heated with 6 mg of L-cysteinemethyl ester at 60 °C for 1 h. Phenylisothiocyanate (0.1 mL) was added to the reaction mixture, which was heated at 60 °C for 1 h. The reaction mixture was evaporated in a water bath, dissolved in acetonitrile, and analyzed via RP-HPLC (Diamonsil C18: 4.6 mm × 250 mm, 5 μm) with a mobile phase of 25% MeOH/water (flow rate of 1 mL/min) and a UV detector (250 nm). Authentic D-glucose and L-glucose were derivatized and analyzed using the same protocol. By comparing the retention times of the sugar derivative obtained from 1 and 2 with the retention times of standard D-glucose (tR 28.20 min) and L-glucose (tR 28.90 min) derivatives, the sugar moiety was determined to be D-glucose (Vinh et al. 2019).

title: Structural elucidation, and molecular docking studies against SARS-CoV-2 main protease of new stigmastane-type steroidal glucosides isolated from the whole plants of Vernonia gratiosa
